name: Imperishable: Deconstructing Ukrainian Embroidery Patterns
description:
Enjoy this exhibition of paintings and media art by artist Rob Gill.

As a second generation Ukrainian on his mother's side, and having been raised with the language, the cultural traditions, and the rich craftwork, he is particularly fascinated by ancient Ukrainian geometric embroidery patterns and the meanings they contain.

In this exhibition, Rob Gill seeks to engage with that ancient, sacred art, uncover some of its spiritual content, and explore his Ukrainian heritage by applying various of his own processes to the patterns via painting, print, computer animation, software design, and audio. Many of his animations are joined by music drawn from the Ukrainian Art Song Project which runs through software to produce the accompanying audio.

name: Amanda Rheaume
description:
The recipient of the 2024 Spirit of Folk Award, 2023 Canadian Fold Music Award for Indigenous Songwriter of the Year and the 2023 Capital Music Awards' Album of the Year, Amanda Rheaume has released six full-length albums to date. 

Beyond recording and touring, Rheaume continues her ever-expanding role as an essential advocate of Indigenous music infrastructure and community.
